intro: Erigeron fuegiae, commonly known as the Falkland Islands fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Falkland Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in coastal and grassland habitats, thriving in the temperate climate of its native region. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring and early summer. Erigeron fuegiae is known for its hardy nature and ability to adapt to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat.
